introduction: Tim Rothman talks about the Price of Anarchy, focusing on the computational complexity of finding the worst-case price of anarchy in a network with a given beta value. He also discusses the use of heuristics and approximation strategies to solve computational problems.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to the Price of Anarchy
content: Explanation of the Price of Anarchy concept and its importance in network optimization.
Discussion of the computational complexity of finding the worst-case price of anarchy.
Introduction to the use of heuristics and approximation strategies in computational problem-solving.
Mention of the New Zealand government's failed auction as an example of the importance of heuristics.

sections.title: Section 2: Computational Complexity and the Price of Anarchy
content: Explanation of the computational complexity of finding the worst-case price of anarchy.
Discussion of the relationship between the computational complexity and the beta value.
Explanation of how the theory can be used to compute the worst-case price of anarchy as a function of the beta value.
Mention of the importance of finding the exact solution in some cases.

sections.title: Section 3: Heuristics and Approximation Strategies
content: Explanation of heuristics and approximation strategies in computational problem-solving.
Discussion of the use of heuristics in auction problems and their effectiveness in reducing bad results.
Mention of the New Zealand government's use of heuristics in their failed auction.
Explanation of the motivation for using heuristics in computational problem-solving.

sections.title: Section 4: The Role of Economic Reasoning in Computational Problem-solving
content: Explanation of the role of economic reasoning in computational problem-solving.
Discussion of the difficulty of finding Nash equilibria and the computational complexity of Nash equilibrium computation.
Explanation of the refined version of NP proposed by Papadimitriou.
Mention of the importance of understanding computational intractability in practice.

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion and Future Directions
content: Summary of the main points discussed in the talk.
Discussion of the importance of finding exact solutions in some cases.
Explanation of the role of heuristics and approximation strategies in computational problem-solving.
Mention of the importance of understanding computational intractability in practice.
